data.author: @OpenCode
data.comment: Assessment complete. Repo is C++20/CMake with SDL2/Allegro/OpenGL; deterministic sim with networking command queue + checksums; savegame binary format; NewGRF pipeline; Squirrel scripting; multi-platform incl. Emscripten. Key migration risks: determinism/desync safety, savegame compatibility, NewGRF behavior, network protocol compatibility.

data.author: @OpenCode
data.comment: Recommendation accepted: Rust-based migration with deterministic sim + byte-accurate serialization to preserve savegames, NewGRF, and network compatibility.

data.author: @OpenCode
data.comment: Phased Rust migration plan: 1) Bootstrap Rust workspace + core libs (io, endian, determinism helpers). 2) Savegame parser: outer container + chunk headers + tests vs known samples. 3) Network protocol framing: packet read/write + compatibility tests. 4) NewGRF decoder: byte reader + action 0/1/2 scaffolding. 5) Deterministic sim core: RNG, date/time, command queue replay. 6) Bridge layer: run new Rust modules alongside existing C++ (tooling or offline validation). 7) UI + rendering port: SDL2/wgpu, sprite cache, font rendering. 8) Full parity + deprecation of C++ subsystems. Compatibility gates: save/load roundtrip, network desync-free replay, NewGRF behavior checks.

data.author: @OpenCode
data.comment: Bootstrapped Rust workspace manually (cargo not available). Added workspace Cargo.toml, core/savegame/cli crates, endian reader, savegame header parser + tests, and CLI to print header. Added /rust/target to .gitignore.

data.author: @OpenCode
data.comment: Completed Rust workspace bootstrap; commit 7755880a69 adds core/savegame/cli crates, endian reader, savegame header parser + tests, CLI, and Rust build instructions.

data.author: @OpenCode
data.comment: Savegame header parser implemented in Rust as part of workspace bootstrap (parse compression magic, version, flags) with unit tests.
